item.title: Docker Volume Permissions with SELinux
item.description: Unfamiliar with running Docker on a SELinux enabled system, I found myself running into a bunch of file permission errors while creating volumes. mkdir: can't create directory '/data': Permission denied $ docker info --format '{{json .SecurityOptions}}' [ "name=seccomp,profile=/etc/docker/seccomp.json", "name=selinux" ] It turns out that this can be resolved by appending the :z flag to the volume mappings in the docker-compose.yml file, indicating that the volume content is shared.

item.title: Upgrading the Firmware on the PCEngines APU2

Since the last time the device has been powered on, there have been many great improvements to the firmware, and it was very-much due for an upgrade.
